summary: Vladivostok is a major city in Russia's Far East, located on the Sea of Japan. It was founded in 1860 and became an important military and naval base. The city grew rapidly, attracting diverse ethnic groups and developing a vibrant public life. After the Russian Revolution, it was occupied by various forces until being absorbed into the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic in 1922. Today, Vladivostok is Russia's largest Pacific port and a cultural hub. It's known for its unique blend of Russian architecture and Asian influences, attracting over 3 million tourists in 2017.
title: Vladivostok
